flawed_nl_solution:
After 30 days, there will be enough food left to sustain 300 people for 90 days - 30 days = 60 days.
After the 100 people leave, there will be 300-100 = <<300-100=20>>20 people left.
The 20 people will eat 20/300 = 20/300 as much food as the original group of people in the castle.
The 60 days' worth of food will last this smaller group for 60 days / (20/300) = <<60/(20/300)=900>>900 more days.
#### 900

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 200, not 20. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
